channel.title: Pages on Syniti Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Syniti Documentation

item.title: Append Utility Columns
item.description: Append Utility Columns Use this page to [Append Columns to all Target or Source Tables](../Use_Cases/Append_Utility_Columns_to_all_Tables) or [Allow Mapping of Utility Columns](../Use_Cases/Allow_Mapping_of_Utility_Columns). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Append Utility Columns in the Navigation pane. Field Description COLUMN Displays the name of the column to append to the table.

item.title: Copy Targets
item.description: Copy Targets Use this page to [Copy a Target in Target Design](../Use_Cases/Copy_a_Target_in_Target_Design). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Objectsicon on the Design page. Click the Copy Targets icon for an Object. Click the Targets to Copy icon on the Select Destination Object For Targets page. Field Description NAME Displays the name of the Target to copy.

item.title: Criticality
item.description: Criticality Use this page to [Add Custom Criticality Levels](../Config/Add_Custom_Criticality_Levels). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Criticality in the Navigation pane. Field Description CRITICALITY Displays the Criticality level used for reporting purposes. The platform is delivered with the values High, Medium, and Low. These values cannot be edited or deleted.

item.title: Database Import
item.description: Database Import Use this page to [Import Target Design from a Database](../Use_Cases/Import_from_a_Database). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click Target Import in the Navigation pane. Click the Database Importicon for an Object. Click the Import icon for the DATA SOURCE. Field Description Mark for Import Click to enable the IMPORT check box for multiple selected tables to include the tables in the import.

item.title: Design
item.description: Design Use this page to access the pages as described below. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Field Description Objects Click to open the Objects page to access pages to work with Targets for the selected Object, to view all field groups for the selected Object, and to access the Summary Construction dashboard.

item.title: Field Groups
item.description: Field Groups Use this page to [Create Field Groups](../Use_Cases/Create_Field_Groups). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Field Groups in the Navigation pane. Field Description FIELD GROUP Displays the name of the field group filter used to organize fields into subsets so that different rules, criticality levels, requirements settings and documentation can be set for these subsets based on values in related fields.

item.title: Metric Groups
item.description: Metric Groups Use this page to [Add a Metric Group](../Use_Cases/Work_with_Metric_Groups#Add_a_metric_group). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Metric Groups in the Navigation pane. Field Description METRIC GROUP Displays the metric group name. The default metric group (*) is assigned to all fields by default. Metric groups are a subcategory of field groups and provide a way to further organize data for metrics tracking and mapping.

item.title: Object Field Groups
item.description: Object Field Groups Use this page to [Assign a Field Group to an Object](../Use_Cases/Assign_a_Field_Group_to_an_Object). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Field Group Setup in the Navigation pane. Field Description OBJECT ID Displays the Object that contains the field group that can be applied to that Object’s Targets.

item.title: Objects
item.description: Objects Use this page to [Access Targets at the Object Level](../Use_Cases/Access_Targets_at_the_Object_Level). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click Objectsicon on the Design page. Field Description Target Import Click to open the Target Object Import page to begin the process of importing a System Type, database table, or Excel file as the basis for a Target design for the selected Object.

item.title: Required
item.description: Required Use this page to [Add Custom Requirement Settings](../Config/Add_Custom_Requirement_Settings). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Required in the Navigation pane. Field Description REQUIRED Displays the Requirement setting, used for reporting. The platform is delivered with the following settings that cannot be edited or deleted. Business Required – Required to meet a business rule or otherwise meet a business need Technical Required – Required by the system Conditional – Required depending on certain conditions Optional – Not required Custom Requirement settings can be added and edited.

item.title: Rules: Basic Rule H
item.description: Rules: Basic Rule H Rules: Basic Rule V Use this page to [Add a Basic Rule](../Use_Cases/Basic_Rules). NOTE: Bulk Execution has been enabled on this page. Refer to Use Bulk Execution for more information. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targets icon on the Design page. Click the Basic Rules icon for a Target. Field

item.title: Rules: Complex Rule H
item.description: Rules: Complex Rule H Rules: Complex Rule V Use this page to [Add a Complex Rule.](../Use_Cases/Complex_Rules#Add_a_Complex_Rule) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Target Rules > Complex Rules in the Navigation pane. Field Description NAME Displays the unique name of the Complex rule to be documented. Complex rules provide information that the Data Services developer uses when writing the rule.

item.title: Rules: Execution Stage Complex Rules
item.description: Rules: Execution Stage Complex Rules Use this page to [View Rules Assigned to an Execution Stage](../Use_Cases/Complex_Rules#View_Rules_Assigned_to_an_Exec). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Target Rules > Execution Stages in the Navigation pane. Click the Complex Rules icon for a stage. Field Description TARGET FIELD ID Displays the name of the active Target field assigned to the Complex rule.

item.title: Rules: Execution Stage H
item.description: Rules: Execution Stage H Rules: Execution Stage V Use this page to [Add an Execution Stage](../Use_Cases/Complex_Rules#Add_an_Execution_Stage). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Target Rules > Execution Stages in the Navigation pane. Field Description NAME Displays the execution stage name. The Execution stage allows Complex rules to be grouped for different execution levels.

item.title: Rules: Field Complex Rules
item.description: Rules: Field Complex Rules Use this page to [Assign theRule to a T Field and Execution Stage.](../Use_Cases/Complex_Rules#Assign_the_Rule_to_a_Field) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targets icon on the Design page. Click the Fields icon for a Target. Click the Complex Rules icon for a field. Field Description TARGET FIELD ID

item.title: Select Destination Object For Targets
item.description: Select Destination Object For Targets Use this page to [Copy a Target in Target Design](../Use_Cases/Copy_a_Target_in_Target_Design). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Objectsicon on the Design page. Click the Copy Targets icon for an Object. Field Description Destination Object Displays the Object to which the Target is copied. Targets to Copy

item.title: Source
item.description: Source Use this page to: - [View Sources Assigned to Targets](../Use_Cases/View_Target_and_Source_Assignments). - [Update System Types for a Source](../Use_Cases/Update_System_Types_for_a_Source) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Source in the Navigation pane. Field Description SOURCE ID Displays the name of the Source data source, a database with the .sdb extension. If the name is sdbDSPConstruct, the Source selected when the Source was added in Target Design was {Full Construction}, a Source built in Construct.

item.title: Source Where Used
item.description: Source Where Used Use this page to [View Target and Source Assignments](../Use_Cases/View_Target_and_Source_Assignments). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Source in the Navigation pane. Click the Targets icon for a Source. Field Description NAME Displays the name of the Target table that uses the Source data source. SOURCE DATA SOURCE

item.title: System Type Import
item.description: System Type Import Use this page to [Import a Target Design from a System Type](../Use_Cases/Import_from_a_System_Type). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click Target Import in Navigation pane. Click the System Types Import icon for the Object. Field Description Mark for Import Click to check the IMPORT check box for multiple selected tables to include the tables in the import.

item.title: Target Contacts
item.description: Target Contacts Use this page to [Add Developers and Business Contacts to a Target or Source](../Use_Cases/Add_Developers_and%20Business%20Contacts). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Developers icon for a Target. Field Description TARGET ID Displays the name of the Target table to which the Developer or Business Contact is assigned.

item.title: Target Dependencies
item.description: Target Dependencies Use this page to [Set Target Dependencies](../Use_Cases/Set_Target_Dependencies). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Dependencies icon for a Target. Field Description Field Dependencies Click to open the Target Dependency Selection page to select Target dependencies for the selected PARENT TARGET ID based on the relationships added on the Target Dependency Relationship page.

item.title: Target Dependency (Children)
item.description: Target Dependency (Children) Use this page to view the dependencies for a Target. Refer to [Set Target Dependencies](../Use_Cases/Set_Target_Dependencies) for more information. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Vertical View icon for a Target. Click the Child Targets icon. Field Description CHILD TARGET ID Displays the name of the Target table that has a child dependency with the selected Target (for example, the selected Target is a parent of this Target).

item.title: Target Dependency (Parents)
item.description: Target Dependency (Parents) Use this page to view the dependencies for a Target. Refer to [Set Target Dependencies](../Use_Cases/Set_Target_Dependencies) for more information. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Vertical View icon for a Target. Click the Parent Targets icon. Field Description PARENT TARGET ID Displays the name of the Target table that has a parent dependency with the selected Target (for example, the selected Target is a child of this Target).

item.title: Target Dependency Relationship
item.description: Target Dependency Relationship Use this page to [Set Target Dependencies](../Use_Cases/Set_Target_Dependencies). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Dependencies icon for a Target. Click the Relationships icon for a dependency. Field Description PARENT TARGET ID Displays the name of the Target table, as set on the Target Dependencies page, that has a parent relationship to the selected table (as in, the selected Target is a child of this Target).

item.title: Target Dependency Selection
item.description: Target Dependency Selection Use this page to [Set Target Dependencies](../Use_Cases/Set_Target_Dependencies). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Dependencies icon for a Target. Click the Find Dependencies icon. Field Description Add Click to add the selected dependency to the Target. When the dependency is added, the ADDED check box is enabled.

item.title: Target Design Pending Changes
item.description: Target Design Pending Changes Use this page when [Syncing Target Design and Map](../Use_Cases/Sync_Map_and_Target_Design_TD). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click Pending Design Changes link in the STATUS OF SYNC field. NOTE: This link is not available if Target Design and Map are in sync for the selected Target.

item.title: Target Fields H
item.description: Target Fields H Target Fields V Use this page to - [Add Fields to a Target](../Use_Cases/Add_Fields_to_a_Target) - [Activate or Deactivate Target Fields for Mapping](../Use_Cases/Activate_Fields_for_Map) - [Extend Fields to Field Groups](../Use_Cases/Extend_a_Field_to_a_Field_Group) NOTE: Bulk Execution has been enabled on this page. Refer to Use Bulk Execution for more information. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page.

item.title: Target Import Configuration
item.description: Target Import Configuration Use this page to edit the import file data source path if necessary while [Importing Target Design from an Excel File](../Use_Cases/Import_from_an_Excel_File). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Import Setup in the Navigation pane. Field Description IMPORT FILE DATASOURCE Displays the data source where the uploaded Excel file is saved before it is imported into Target Design.

item.title: Target Import: Excel Import H
item.description: Target Import: Excel Import H Target Import: Excel Import V Use this page to [Import Target Design from an Excel File](../Use_Cases/Import_from_an_Excel_File). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click Target Import in the Navigation pane. Click the Excel Importicon. Field Description EXCEL TEMPLATE Click to download the formatted TargetImport_Template.xls. The template contains instructions for data entry.

item.title: Target Lookup Table H
item.description: Target Lookup Table H Target Lookup Table V Use this page to [Set up Lookup Tables](../Use_Cases/Set_up_Lookup_Tables). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Lookup Table Setup in the Navigation pane. Field Description Value Mapping (Config) Click to open the Value Mapping (Config) page in Map to refresh lookup table values after changers to configuration of a lookup table.

item.title: Target Object Import
item.description: Target Object Import Use this page to access the pages as described below for the selected Object. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Target Import icon in the Navigation pane. Field Description OBJECT ID Displays the name of the Object as created in Console. System Types Import

item.title: Target Object Import: Database
item.description: Target Object Import: Database Use this page to [Import Target Design from a Database](../Use_Cases/Import_from_a_Database). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click Target Import in the Navigation pane. Click the Database Importicon. Field Description DATA SOURCE ID Displays the name of the data source that relates to the tables to import.

item.title: Target Object Import: System Types
item.description: Target Object Import: System Types Use this page to [Import a Target Design from a System Type](../Use_Cases/Import_from_a_System_Type). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click Target Import in the Navigation pane. Click the System Types Importicon. Field Description SYSTEM TYPE Displays the name of the System Type to be imported into the Target.

item.title: Target Source Contacts
item.description: Target Source Contacts Use this page to [Add Developers and Business Contacts to a Source](../Use_Cases/Add_Developers_and%20Business%20Contacts). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Sources icon for a Target. Click the Developers icon for a Source. Field Description SOURCE ID Displays the name of the Target table and the Source database to which the Developer or Business Contact is assigned.

item.title: Target Sources H
item.description: Target Sources H Target Sources V Use this page to [Assign a Source to a Target](../Use_Cases/Assign_a_Source_to_a_Target). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Sources icon for a Target. Field Description SOURCE DATA SOURCE Displays the database that stores the Source tables that contain the data that will be migrated to the Target.

item.title: Target Table Join
item.description: Target Table Join This page is used to document joins in the Target tables. Refer to [Add Relationship Joins to Sources](../../Map/Use_Cases/Add_Relationship_Joins_to_Source) for more information. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Click the Vertical View icon for a Target. Click the Target Table Join icon. Field Description

item.title: Target Type
item.description: Target Type This page displays the Target Types installed with the platform. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Target Type in the Navigation pane. Field Description TARGET TYPE Displays the Target Type. The platform is delivered with the following types that cannot be edited or deleted. Natural – A field that exists in the Target system.

item.title: Targets H
item.description: Targets H Targets V Use this page to: - [Sync Map and Target Design](../Use_Cases/Sync_Map_and_Target_Design_TD) - [Add a Basic Rule](../Use_Cases/Basic_Rules) - [Set a Target's Design Status](../Use_Cases/Set_the_Design_Status) - [Set Target Dependencies](../Use_Cases/Set_Target_Dependencies) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Click the Targetsicon on the Design page. Field Description Target Import Click to open the Target Object Import page, to begin the process of importing a System Type, database table or Excel file as the basis for a Target design.

item.title: Utility Field Defaults
item.description: Utility Field Defaults Use this page to [Add Utility Field Defaults](../Use_Cases/Add_Utility_Field_Defaults). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Design in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Utility Field Defaults in the Navigation pane. Field Description NAME Displays the name that displays in the DEFAULT VALUE list box on the Append Utility Column page.
